Name: Jai Schulz
Review: The most I've ever spent on a mouse prior to this was about $50 so I was very hesitant about dropping over $100 for this but I'm glad I did. Originally wanted to get the Apple Magic Mouse for the built in touch pad however never liked the ergonomics of it even though I have relatively small hands.Initially I felt that the MX Master might be a bit too big for my hands and I was close to returning it however after about 2 days I became used to it and now it feels very comfortable to use.The side scroll and thumb gesture button almost mimics the functionality of the Magic Mouse, allowing you to perform actions such as opening Mission Control, switch desktops etc.The scrolling is very smooth and you can easily switch between frictionless and ratchet scrolling. The frictionless scrolling is amazing and you can easily get through large documents with a simple flick, however I find that it is a bit sensitive so generally leave it in the normal mode which is still very good but feels more tactile.Only real negative I have for it is the rubberised area where your palm rests. It gets a bit dirty and can get easily scratched by an inadvertent fingernail as you switch between using the mouse and keyboard. Luckily it's easy to rub out however I think deeper scratches might leave a more permanent mark.Highly recommended especially if you use a Mac and want to retain the functionality of the trackpad but you don't like the ergonomics of the Magic Mouse.
